text: we generally think we understand
reality but uh when you see something
like that it can make you question that
it can make you suspend your ideas and I
think that's why it's really interesting
to me it's not because you know some
people look at it as oh you know it
expands what's possible but it's more to
me what's interesting is it gets people
to suspend their ideas about reality and
not to be so sure that we know because I
think we often think that we already
understand reality we think that our
world viw is more or less complete that
maybe there's some things that we don't
know and some things that we don't
understand but more or less we've got a

that into question and and that creates
space for uh us to discover a lot more
depth about who we are and why are we
here no I I never explain what I do and
that's uh unique to my style because I
like to I like to I don't tell people
whether what I do is real or not real I
like to um leave them guessing and
that's part of what creates this sense
of suspension of the ideas because if I
told them that it wasn't real
they'd have some ideas about it and if I
told them that it was real they would
just form some other ideas about it as
well and I like to keep people perfectly
in the Middle where they're not sure and
it's much more
interesting I don't think they're
overfocused I mean I think we have
certain belief systems that uh but I
find that people are
remarkably open I've performed for
scientists and I'm always doctors and
I'm always amazed at how open they are I
think uh it's not that we tend to be
skeptical is we've been given a very
materialistic framework for
existence and uh we don't yet have a way
even when we experience something
non-materialistic whether it's psychic
or spiritual which are two different
things if we experience either of those
we don't necessarily have a conceptual
framework or understanding to to make

to kind of dismiss it but I don't think
it's that people are necessarily overly
skeptical I'm always amazed at how
open-minded people are
